newsitem.title: USA: American General to buy Home Beneficial.
newsitem.headline: American General to buy Home Beneficial.

text.p: American General Corp., one of the nation's largest diversified financial services groups, said Monday it has a definitive agreement to acquire Home Beneficial Corp. for $665 million.

American General, one of the most aggressive buyers in the consolidating insurance industry, said Home Beneficial shareholders can choose to be paid in either cash or common stock under the $39 per share deal.
Up to half the total price will be paid in cash, and up to 75 percent in American General stock.
The news sent Home Beneficial's stock surging $8.75 or almost 30 percent early on Nasdaq. American General edged down 12.5 cents to $40.125 on the New York Stock Exchange.
"Home Beneficial is an excellent strategic fit with our Nashville-based life insurance subsidiary," said Robert M. Devlin, president and chief executive of American General.
"Through the combination of these two companies, we believe we can achieve economies of scale resulting in annual expense savings of $20 million."
The deal is expected to close at the end of March and stop weighing on earnings within a year after that, he said.

The deal is American General's third life insurance company acquisition in the past two years, for a total cost of $2.2 billion, and strengthens the company's position as one of the nation's five biggest life insurers on the basis of sales.
Moreover, the Houston-based company will gain economies of scale and a boost to earnings at a time when sales of conventional life insurance policies are falling for many companies, analysts said.
American General, with assets of $64 billion, is a leading provider of retirement services, consumer loans, and life insurance to nine million households.

Founded in 1899 and based in Richmond, Va., Home Beneficial has assets of $1.4 billion and $11 billion in life insurance in force. Home Beneficial had net income of $38 million over the past year. It is the holding company of Home Beneficial Life Insurance Co., which operates in six Mid-Atlantic states and Washington, D.C., through more than 1,000 agents and sales managers.
